verses.english: For you have not come to a tangible mountain, Mount Sinai, that could be touched—a mountain blazing with fire, surrounded by a whirlwind, darkness, and storm,

verses.latin: et tubae sonum, et verborum vocem, quam qui audierunt, deprecati sunt ne ultra loqueretur eis.
verses.english: nor to the sound of a trumpet, nor to a voice speaking words so terrifying that those who heard it begged that no further word be spoken to them.

verses.latin: Portabant enim quod dicebatur: Et si bestia tetigerit montem, lapidabitur.
verses.english: For they could not endure the command that was given: "If even an animal touches the mountain, it shall be stoned."

verses.latin: Et ita terribile erat, quod videbatur, ut Moyses diceret: Exterritus sum, et tremens.
verses.english: So terrifying was that sight that even Moses said, "I am terrified and trembling."

verses.latin: Sed accessistis ad Sion montem, et civitatem Dei viventis, Ierusalem caelestem, et multorum millium angelorum frequentiam,
verses.english: But you have come instead to Mount Sion, to the city of the living God, which is the heavenly Jerusalem, and to an innumerable company of angels,

verses.latin: et Ecclesiam primogenitorum, qui conscripti sunt in caelis, et judicem omnium Deum, et spiritus justorum perfectorum,
verses.english: and to the Church of the firstborn, whose names are written in the heavenly registry, and to God, the Judge of all, and to the spirits of the righteous who have been made perfect,

verses.latin: et testamenti novi mediatorem Iesum, et sanguinem aspersionis melius loquentem quam Abel.
verses.english: and to Jesus, the Mediator of the new covenant, and to the sprinkled blood which speaks a better word than the blood of Abel, which cries out for vengeance.

verses.latin: Videte ne denegatis loquentem. Si enim illi non effugerunt, denegantes eum, qui super terram loquebatur: multo magis nos, qui de caelis locutum aversamur.
verses.english: See to it that you do not refuse Him who speaks. For if those who refused Him who spoke on Earth, the Law through Moses, did not escape punishment, how much less shall we escape if we turn away from Him who speaks to us from the heavens, Jesus Christ!

verses.latin: Cujus vox terram movit tunc: nunc autem denuntiat, dicens: Adhuc semel, et ego movebo non solum terram, sed et caelum.
verses.english: His voice then shook the Earth at Sinai, but now He has promised, saying: "Yet once more, I will shake not only the Earth, but also the entire created universe."

verses.latin: Quod autem, Adhuc semel, dicit: declarat mobilium translationem tamquam factorum, ut maneant ea quae sunt immobilia.
verses.english: Now, this phrase "Yet once more" signifies the removal of created things that can be shaken, so that those things that cannot be shaken may remain and stand firm forever.

verses.latin: Idcirco ergo regnum immobile suscipientes, habemus gratiam, per quam serviamus placentes Deo, cum metu et reverentia.
verses.english: Therefore, since we are receiving an unshakable Kingdom, let us be grateful, and by this gratitude, let us serve God acceptably with reverence and awe.

verses.latin: Deus enim noster ignis consumens est.
verses.english: For our God is a consuming fire, a refining fire that purifies His Saints and destroys His enemies.

verses.latin: Caritas fraternitatis maneat in vobis.
verses.english: Let the love of your fellow Christians remain in your hearts.

verses.latin: Hospitalitatem nolite oblivisci: per hanc enim latuerunt quidam, angelis hospitio receptis.
verses.english: Do not neglect to show hospitality to strangers. Through this practice, some people have unknowingly given shelter to angels.

verses.latin: Mementote vinctorum, quasi simul vincti: et laborantium, quasi et ipsi in corpore agentes.
verses.english: Remember those who are imprisoned for their faith, as if you yourselves were chained with them. Also, remember those who are suffering, as if you yourselves were experiencing the same physical hardships.

verses.latin: Honorabile connubium in omnibus, et torus immaculatus: fornicatores enim et adulteros judicabit Deus.
verses.english: Let marriage be held in honor by all people, and let the marriage bed remain undefiled by sin. For God will certainly judge those who engage in sexual immorality and adultery.

verses.latin: Sint mores sine avaritia, contenti præsentibus: ipse enim dixit: Non te deseram, neque dereliquam.
verses.english: Your way of life should be free from the sin of avarice. Be content with the material blessings you currently possess. For God Himself has promised us, saying: "I will never abandon you; nor will I ever desert you."

verses.latin: Ita ut confidenter dicamus: Dominus mihi adjutor: non timebo quid faciat mihi homo.
verses.english: So, with firm confidence, we can proclaim: "The Lord is my unfailing helper and protector. Therefore, I will not fear anything that any human being can do to harm me."

verses.latin: Mementote præpositorum vestrorum, qui vobis locuti sunt verbum Dei: quorum intuentes exitum conversationis, imitamini fidem.
verses.english: Remember your spiritual leaders, the ones who first taught you the saving Word of God. Consider carefully the outcome of their way of life, how they persevered in faith until death, and imitate their unwavering faith in God.

verses.latin: Jesus Christus heri, et hodie: ipse et in sæcula.
verses.english: Jesus Christ is the same divine person always. He was the same yesterday, He is the same today, and He will remain the same for all eternity.

verses.latin: Doctrinis variis et peregrinis nolite abduci. Optimum est enim gratia stabiliri cor, non escis, quæ non profuerunt ambulantibus in illis.
verses.english: Do not allow yourselves to be led astray by various and unfamiliar doctrines. It is far better for your heart to be strengthened and established by God's grace, rather than by rules concerning foods, which have proven useless to those who meticulously observed them.

verses.latin: Habemus altare, de quo edere non habent potestatem, qui tabernaculo deserviunt.
verses.english: We Christians have a spiritual altar, from which to eat. Those who continue to serve in the Old Covenant tabernacle rituals have no right or power to partake of this new, perfect sacrifice.

verses.latin: Quorum enim sanguis importatur in sancta per pontificem pro peccato, horum corpora cremantur extra castra.
verses.english: In the Old Covenant, the blood of certain animals was brought into the Holy of Holies by the high priest to atone for sin. The bodies of those very animals were then burned completely outside the camp of Israel.

verses.latin: Propter quod et Jesus, ut sanctificaret per suum sanguinem populum, extra portam passus est.
verses.english: For this reason, Jesus Himself, in order to sanctify His people through the shedding of His own precious blood, suffered and died outside the city gate of Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Exeamus igitur ad eum extra castra, improperium ejus portantes.
verses.english: Let us, therefore, courageously go forth from the old ways and join Him outside the camp, willingly bearing the same scorn and disgrace that He endured.

verses.latin: Non enim habemus hic manentem civitatem, sed futuram inquirimus.
verses.english: For we do not possess a permanent earthly city or homeland in this present world. Instead, we are earnestly seeking the heavenly city and everlasting Kingdom that is yet to come.

verses.latin: Per ipsum ergo offeramus hostiam laudis semper Deo, id est, fructum labiorum confitentium nomini ejus.
verses.english: Therefore, through Jesus Christ, let us continually offer to God a sacrifice of praise. This sacrifice is the spiritual fruit of our lips, which confess and glorify His holy Name.

verses.latin: Beneficentiæ autem et communionis nolite oblivisci: talibus enim hostiis promeretur Deus.
verses.english: Moreover, do not forget to do good works for others and to share your material possessions with those in need. For God is truly pleased and propitiated by such sacrifices of charity.

verses.latin: Obedite præpositis vestris, et subjacete eis. Ipsi enim pervigilant pro animabus vestris, quasi rationem reddituri: ut cum gaudio hoc faciant, et non gementes: hoc enim non expedit vobis.
verses.english: Obey your spiritual leaders and humbly submit to their authority. For they diligently watch over your immortal souls, knowing that they will one day have to give an account to God for their stewardship. Obey them so that they may carry out their duties with joy, and not with sorrowful groaning, for that would certainly not be beneficial for your spiritual welfare.

verses.latin: Orate pro nobis: confidimus enim quia bonam habemus conscientiam in omnibus, bene volentes conversari.
verses.english: Please pray for us, your spiritual guides. We are confident that we possess a good and clear conscience in all matters, as we earnestly desire to conduct ourselves honorably in every aspect of our lives.

verses.latin: Amplius autem peto vos hoc facere: quo celerius restituar vobis.
verses.english: I especially implore you to pray for this specific intention: that I may be restored to your presence more quickly.

verses.latin: Deus autem pacis, qui eduxit de mortuis pastorem magnum ovium, in sanguine testamenti æterni, Dominum nostrum Jesum Christum,
verses.english: Now, may God, the very source of all peace, who, through the precious blood of the eternal covenant, brought back from the dead our Lord Jesus Christ, the great Shepherd of His flock,

verses.latin: aptet vos in omni bono, ut faciatis voluntatem ejus: faciens in vobis quod placeat coram se per Jesum Christum: cui est gloria in sæcula sæculorum. Amen.
verses.english: may He perfectly equip and prepare you in every good work, enabling you to faithfully accomplish His divine will. May He accomplish within you, through Jesus Christ, that which is truly pleasing in His sight. To this same Jesus Christ be all glory and honor, for all ages, forever and ever. Amen.

verses.latin: Rogo autem vos, fratres, ut sufferatis verbum solatii: nam et per paucis scripsi vobis.
verses.english: Now, brothers and sisters, I earnestly ask you to patiently receive this message of consolation and encouragement. For, indeed, I have written to you in a relatively brief manner.

verses.latin: Cognoscite fratrem nostrum Timotheum dimissum: cum quo (si celerius venerit) videbo vos.
verses.english: Understand that our brother Timothy has been released from his confinement. If he arrives quickly, I plan to visit you along with him.

verses.latin: Salutate omnes præpositos vestros, et omnes sanctos. Salutant vos de Italia.
verses.english: Extend my greetings to all your spiritual leaders, and to all the holy people in your community. The Christian believers here in Italy also send their greetings to you.

verses.latin: Gratia vobiscum omnibus. Amen.
verses.english: May the grace of God be with all of you. Amen.
